The timeseries module¶

fadra.timeseries module¶

class fadra.timeseries.TimeSeries(data, errors, labels=None, epoch=None)¶

Bases: object

errors_group1()¶

Returns error channels of the first group.

Returns:list of SciPy arrays
errors_group2()¶

Returns error channels of the second group.

Returns:list of SciPy arrays
get_error(item)¶

Retuns error channel for target given in item.

Parameters:item – ID of the target. Can be number or label name.
Returns:error associated to photometry of said target
Return type:SciPy array
group1()¶

Returns first grouping of photometry channels.

Returns:list of SciPy arrays
group2()¶

Returns second grouping of photometry channels.

Returns:list of SciPy arrays
mean(group_id)¶

Calculates the mean of the channels stored in group group_id. Also calculated for error channels. Result is stored in channel timeserie[-group_id]

Parameters:group_id – int. 1 or 2.
median(group_id)¶

Calculates the median of the channels stored in group group_id. Also calculated for error channels. Result is stored in channel timeserie[-group_id]

Parameters:group_id – int. 1 or 2.
plot(label=None, axes=None)¶

Display the timeseries data: flux (with errors) as function of mjd

Parameters:label – Specify a single star to plot
Rtype label:basestring
Return type:None (and plot display)
set_epoch(e)¶

Sets epoch for time serie

Parameters:e – epoch
set_group(new_group)¶

Sets a grouping inside the TimeSeries object. Targets can be grouped or ungrouped together as a way to easily perform operations between many of them.

Parameters:new_group – Mask of 0s and 1s. 1s are the first group. Ex: [0 1 0 0 1 0] defines the first group to contain targets 2 and 5; second group contains targets 1, 3, 4 and 6.
set_labels(ids)¶

Sets name labels for each channel

Parameters:ids (list of strings) – list of label names
Returns:List of strings
